translations.meaning: phương tiện truyền thông đại chúng

examples.sentence: The mass media includes all forms of media that reach a large audience, such as television, radio, newspapers, and the Internet.
The mass media plays a crucial role in keeping people informed about current events around the world.
The newspaper is filled with advertisements for new products and services.
The magazine featured a full-page advertisement for a luxury car.
The news program's coverage of the crisis was praised for its accuracy and depth.
The news program's investigative journalism uncovered a major corruption scandal in the government.
The news agency was the first to report on the breaking story.
The news agency has a team of experienced journalists who cover stories from around the world.
I prefer to get my news from a reliable news outlet, such as The New York Times.
The news outlet has faced criticism in recent months for biased reporting.
The news outlet has won numerous awards for its investigative reporting and in-depth coverage.
The weather forecast on the national news channel predicts rain for the upcoming weekend.
I always check the regional weather forecast before planning a trip to the beach.
The accuracy of the weather forecast from that news agency is impressive.
Documentaries can be a great way to learn about different cultures and traditions.
Last night I watched a fantastic documentary on climate change on the Discovery Channel.
The documentary on the impact of social media on our lives was eye-opening.
Some game shows have become so popular that they have been adapted for international audiences, such as "Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?".
While many game shows offer cash prizes for contestants, others offer the opportunity to showcase their talents on national television.
Last night's talk show focused on mental health and featured personal stories from guests who have overcome challenges.
The talk show guest was a survivor of a natural disaster who shared their harrowing experience.
Many celebrities have started their own podcasts to connect with fans and share their personal experiences.
I enjoy listening to a comedy podcast during my lunch break to help me relax and destress.
The great thing about podcasts is that you can listen to them anywhere, anytime, making them a convenient way to stay informed and entertained.
The success of the website's readership is due in part to its engaging and informative articles.
The newspaper's readership declined after it changed its format and layout.
The company issued a press release about their new product launch.
The politician's office sent out a press release to address recent rumors.
The radio broadcast was interrupted with breaking news about the natural disaster that had just occurred.
The journalist rushed to the scene to cover the breaking news of the protest turning violent.
The TV station interrupted its regularly scheduled programming with a breaking news announcement.
I can't seem to find yesterday's issue of the Wall Street Journal.
The Sunday issue of the Los Angeles Times is always thicker than the weekday issues.
I subscribe to the print version of Time magazine and receive each issue in the mail every morning.

translations.meaning: tin sốc được phóng đại nhằm thu hút lượt xem

examples.sentence: I hate it when websites use clickbait headlines just to get people to click on their articles.
I try to avoid websites that use clickbait because I find the headlines to be misleading and often irrelevant to the actual content.
It's important to be able to distinguish between real news and clickbait so that you don't fall for fake stories.
It is important to fact-check information before sharing it to avoid contributing to the spread of misinformation.
The media has a responsibility to combat misinformation by presenting accurate and balanced reporting.
The internet has made it easier for misinformation to spread rapidly.

translations.meaning: thông tin sai lệch do cố ý

examples.sentence: Journalists have a responsibility to combat disinformation by rigorously fact-checking and verifying sources before reporting on them.
The journalist was fired for knowingly publishing disinformation about the celebrity's personal life.
The investigative journalist uncovered a network that was spreading disinformation about vaccines.
The newspaper's credibility has been called into question after too many inaccurate reports recently.
It's important to consider the credibility of the author before accepting their claims as fact.
The government's censorship of the media has been a topic of controversy for years.
Censorship can be a double-edged sword, protecting society from harmful content while also restricting freedom of expression.
The issue of censorship raises questions about who gets to decide what is acceptable and what is not.
Some newspapers are known for their sensational coverage of events, which can be misleading and unfair.
The news channels are criticized for their sensational coverage of natural disasters, often ignoring the human aspect of the tragedy.
The sensational reporting of crime stories can lead to widespread panic in the society.
The controversial article on the benefits of veganism has sparked a heated debate among the readership of the newspaper.
The article on gun control was highly controversial, with both sides of the debate fiercely disagreeing.
Fake news can have serious consequences, such as damaging reputations or causing panic and violence.
The spread of fake news on social media platforms has become a major concern.
It's important to fact-check information before sharing it to avoid spreading fake news.
The prevalence of yellow journalism on social media has made it harder for people to distinguish real news from fake news.
The use of clickbait headlines and misleading information is often associated with yellow journalism tactics.

translations.meaning: tính xác thực của nội dung

examples.sentence: Social media platforms have a responsibility to ensure the content they display has content validity and is not spreading false information.
The content validity of the social media posts is usually not high, as they were often based on rumors and speculation.
In today's era of fake news and misinformation, it's more important than ever to prioritize content validity in the media.
Nowadays, people prefer to watch TV shows and movies on demand rather than following a fixed schedule.
Streaming platforms like Netflix and Amazon Prime offer a wide range of content that can be watched on demand at any time.
I can't wait for the latest issue of my favorite magazine to come out.
The newspaper article about the political scandal is expected to come out tomorrow.
As a responsible media consumer, it is important to trust in sources that have a proven track record of accuracy and reliability.
It can be difficult to trust in media reports when they are biased or have an agenda to push.

translations.meaning: kiểm tra, xác thực tin tức

examples.sentence: The news agency made sure to fact-check every claim before publishing the story.
The newspaper hired additional staff to fact-check all of their articles after a controversy over misinformation.
We cannot simply trust everything we read online and should take the time to fact-check information.

translations.meaning: đăng ký đặt mua dài hạn

examples.sentence: I pay a monthly subscription to have access to my favorite news website's content.
Many people are willing to pay a subscription for news websites for an ad-free experience.
Without paying a subscription, you can only read the first few paragraphs of the article.
